events.title: The Apprentice TV show debuts
events.description: Donald Trump becomes a reality television star with NBC's The Apprentice, boosting his personal brand and generating millions in TV fees and future licensing deals. The show's catchphrase "You're fired!" becomes iconic.

moneyFlow.description: Trump reportedly received $3 million per episode as executive producer of The Apprentice. The show would eventually generate approximately $427 million from licensing and endorsement deals over its 14-year run.

events.title: Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
events.description: Burdened by $1.8 billion in debt and poor Atlantic City revenues, Trump's publicly traded casino company seeks bankruptcy protection. Trump's personal stake shrinks to about 10%, but he retains a figurehead role.

moneyFlow.description: Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to restructure $1.8 billion in debt. Trump's personal stake was reduced from approximately 47% to around 10%, though he retained a figurehead role.

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer and businessman who significantly expanded his celebrity status in 2004 by becoming the star of NBC's reality TV show 'The Apprentice'. This marked a shift in his public profile from primarily a real estate figure to a mainstream entertainment celebrity.
